result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquel Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquel Reed

records.addlTxt: Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Aileen Henry in court for Marquel Reed. Defendant Marquel Reed in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Voluntary appearance. Court quashes authorization of warrant and does not forfeit bond. On state's motion the repeater enhancer is dismissed. DE pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds DE guilty of court 1. Court imposes 60 days jail with credit for 55 days served. DE to pay $100 DV surcharge. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge. DNA notice given to Dept when they came to sign the dispo.
With Attorney Henry a VA has been set to 10/12/22 at 8:30.

Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Aileen Henry in court for Marquel Reed. Defendant Marquel Reed not in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Due to the non appearance of the DE court forfeits bond and issues a $1,500 warrant. Stayed until 10/10/22 at 4:00.
Review scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Aaliyah C., Michael J.

01:10 PM    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  PO Hold.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.  $800  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).   ts
and witness list filed by the State
